text.0:
How did Nigeria perform in the Sustainable Development Goals in the last five years? Here's are the facts: https://t.co/BGi6Zxs9MF
#DubawaChecks #FactCheck #SDGs
text.1:
A published story by Vanguard Newspaper and several other blogs that ASUU interacted with students on Twitter and asked them about the trade they’ve learnt so far is false. ASUU has denied operating said twitter account. Read more here: https://t.co/nxSoOqh7am
#DubawaChecks
text.2:
The claim that the gold deposits in Zamfara State belong to Zamfara State is false. The federal government has ownership of all minerals according to the Nigeria Minerals and Mining Act of  2007. Read the full #FactCheck here: https://t.co/164UM4vP00
#DubawaChecks
text.3:
Since the outbreak of #Covid19, several fact-checks have been published to fight misinformation in Nigeria. Study shows that news on potential cure, palliatives and prevention are often shared on social media in Nigeria. Read the study here: https://t.co/3WWNfbvt9W
#DubawaChecks
text.4:
Our Newsletter for October 12, 2020 focuses on the Media Organisations on the Frontline of Combating Information Disorder in Nigeria. It also contains our #FactCheck of the week and many more. Read here: https://t.co/j9GFSpfXae
#DubawaChecks
